intro: Crambe koktebelica, commonly known as the Koktebel crambe, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, blooming in the summer months. The seeds of Crambe koktebelica are encased in a hard capsule and are often used for oil extraction due to their high lipid content.
